CatDescriptText: Mrs. Geneva Favor, 7149 Tilden Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 25, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that business and employment are as good as the Eisenhower administration declares that it is?" answer reads: "No, it isn't. Things aren't as good as they were.  Things have been going down ever since the Eisenhower administration came into office.  There are so many people out of work.  We didn't have this before."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Geneva Favor wearing light colored blouse with pearl edged collar and floral brooch, holding bag and newspaper, standing in front of vacant lot with tree on left
